newsitem.title: USA: Universal International to purchase stores.
newsitem.headline: Universal International to purchase stores.

text.p: Universal International Inc said Tuesday it has agreed to purchase the leases and inventory of about 90 retail locations and the warehouse of Perry Brothers Inc of Lufkin, Texas.

The purchase requires Universal to assume or retire most of Perry's liabilities, pay Perry $700,000 over seven years and issue to Perry 450,000 shares of Universal's common stock. Universal officials were not available to elaborate on the amount of Perry's liabilities.
The purchase is expected to close within 120 days and is contingent on further due diligence and Universal obtaining both equity and debt financing to complete the transaction, Universal said.
Universal intends to convert the Perry stores from variety stores into closeout stores similar to Universal's Only Deals chain, the company said.
